Dear Kari Ann Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing, on the CWL-4617 within 15 days, with
submission of the corrective action plan. If you do not submit the CWL-4617, it will be
treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a provisional license, you must
still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff allegedly threw a youth to the floor and punched him after
the youth threw urine on him.
Investigation On 9/28/23, I spoke to Complainant 1. No new information was
provided.
On 9/28/23, I spoke to Administrator 1. Administrator 1 reported
Youth A threw urine on Staff 1 and then Staff 1 was aggressive
with Youth A, punching him.
I spoke to DHHS Worker 1. Scheduling was discussed.
Video Footage:
I watched the video footage. The incident occurred on 9/26/23 at
2:17pm. I watched video footage from 2:17:00pm - 2:19:18pm.
The youth on the unit were in a circle, sitting down. Staff 1 was
sitting in the circle next to Staff 2 and Staff 5 was standing up
outside of the circle. Youth A left the circle went to his room and
brough back a small cup filled with liquid at 2:17:32. Youth A threw
the liquid on Staff 1. The liquid was confirmed to be Youth A’s
urine. At 2:17:40, Staff 1 stood up and punched Youth A and
threw Youth A up against the wall. At 2:17:44 Staff 1 pushes
Youth A face down into the ground. Youth A falls and Staff 1
places himself on top of Youth A and remains there. At 2:18:02
2

Staff 1 picks him up and throws Youth A back down to the ground.
At 2:18:08, Staff 1 picks up Youth A again and throws him back to
the ground. Staff 1 has his hands around Youth A’s neck when he
throws him to the floor. At 2:18:19, Staff 1’s left hand is around
Youth A’s neck, and he is holding Youth A to the floor. At 2:18:48,
Staff 1’s hand is now on the left side of Youth A’s neck holding
him to the floor and security officers now come into the unit and
are able to get Staff 1 away from Youth A. Youth A is placed into
his bedroom. Staff 1 has been removed from the unit.
Throughout this incident, Staff 2 and Staff 5 were attempting to get
Staff1 away from Youth A but were unable to do this.
All interviews were conducted with DHHS Worker 1 unless
otherwise specified.
Interviews:
Youth A:
Youth A reported he threw urine on Staff 1 because Youth B
threatened to assault him if he did not do it. Youth A reported that
Youth B hit him about a month ago and since then threatens him
and takes his snacks and food. Youth A reported that Youth B will
take his food in the dining hall and at 3:00pm snack time. Youth A
reported that Youth B runs the unit. Youth A reported Supervisor 1
and Therapist 1 were aware he was being bullied by Youth B.
They were both aware he was giving away snacks and dinners to
Youth B. Youth A reported that Supervisor 1 would give him extra
snacks at night because he knew he was giving his away. Youth A
reported he threw urine on Staff 1 and then Staff 1 grabbed him by
the neck and punched him a couple times. Youth A reported Staff
1 pinned him to the ground and was choking him and he couldn’t
breathe at times. Youth A reported after the incident he was
placed into his room for seclusion until 4:30 where he then saw
the nurse. Youth A reported he was not given any medication but
received a gauze on his wrist and was cleaned up when he did
see the nurse.
Youth C:
Youth C reported Youth A threw urine on Staff 1. Staff 1 then
punched Youth A and threw him on the ground and started
choking him. Youth C reported security officers came into the
room and pulled Staff 1 off Youth A. Youth C reported that Youth
B takes snacks, lunches, and dinners from Youth A.
3

Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported that she was working on the pod during the
incident. Staff 2 reported she saw Youth A throw urine on Staff 1.
Staff 1 then assaulted Youth A. Staff 2 reported she attempted to
remove Staff 1 from Youth A but was unable to. Staff 2 reported
that other staff came in and was able to pull Staff 1 off of Youth A.
Staff 2 reported that Youth A then was placed in his room and
came out two hours later when the nurse saw him.
Staff 5:
Staff 5 confirmed Staff 1 assaulted Youth A after Youth A threw
urine on Staff 1.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 was unable to be interviewed due to police involvement at
this time.
Documents Reviewed:
Unusual Incident Report Summary: The incident report was
written on 9/26/23. The incident occurred at 2:17pm. It was noted
as a “staff assault on resident.” The incident report stated, “Staff 1
charged towards Youth A, throwing a punch with his left
hand…grabbed him by the shoulders and slammed Youth A to the
floor with his hands around his neck…
Analysis Video footage clearly displays Staff 1 assaulting Youth A by
punching, choking, throwing, pushing, and pulling Youth A.
Interviews confirm as well as incident Report.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure
Section facilities; seclusion plan; prohibitions; reductions and
Description elimination.
(6) Staff may not place youth in seclusion for fixed periods of
time. Staff must release the youth from seclusion as soon as
the youth has regained self-control and is no longer engaging
in behavior that threatens immediate harm to the youth or
others.
4

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was placed in seclusion at 2:19pm and was not removed
until 4:30. There is no documentation on why Youth A was placed
in seclusion or how he was monitored.
Investigation I reviewed video of the incident.
Youth A was placed into his room at 2:19pm on 9/26/23 after he
was assaulted by Staff 1.
Interviews:
Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported she saw Youth A throw urine on Staff 1. Staff 1
then assaulted Youth A. Staff 2 reported she attempted to remove
Staff 1 from Youth A but was unable to. Staff 2 reported that other
staff came in and were able to pull Staff 1 off of Youth A.
Staff 2 reported that Youth A then was placed in his room and
came out two hours later when the nurse saw him.
Staff 2 was reinterviewed on 11/9/23 and reported that Youth A
did not stay in seclusion long maybe an hour or two. Staff 2
completed the seclusion log checks from 2:30-3:30pm. Staff 2
reported that 15-minute checks were completed. Staff 2 reported
that Youth A would talk with her at the door. Staff 2 reported that
he was not yelling or cussing. Staff 2 reported he was doing “fine.”
Staff 5:
Staff 5 was reinterviewed on 11/9/23 and reported that Youth A
was calm while in his room. Staff 5 completed the seclusion log
checks from 3:45-4:30pm. Staff 5 reported that he was “chill” and
stated Youth A was asking why he was in seclusion. Staff 5
reported she did see supervisors come in and talk to him, but they
did not talk to her to see how he was doing. Staff 5 reported that
when they came into the room Youth A was calm as well.
Youth A:
Youth A reported after the incident he was placed into his room for
seclusion until 4:30 where he then saw the nurse.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the Unusual Incident Report dated 9/26/23.
Youth A was placed into seclusion after he was assaulted by Staff
1. Reason was not documented on the form.
I reviewed the Medical Assessment dated 9/26/23. Youth was
seen at 4:30pm.
5

I requested seclusion documents on 10/30/23 and 11/4/23. No
documentation was provided.
Documentation was received on 11/8/23 for seclusion. Behavior
management/Seclusion Room Logging was reviewed. Youth went
into seclusion at 2:45pm and was removed at 4:30. The logging
states the reason why Youth A was placed in seclusion was
“assault.”
Staff 2 initials were placed on the time frame 2:30-3:30pm and
Staff 5 from 3:45-4:30pm.
Administrative Review Form for use of Seclusion Room was
reviewed. Supervisor 2 reported that at 3:00pm and at 3:45pm
Youth A, “did not appear to be under emotional control.” Seclusion
was continued due to this issue.
Analysis Youth A was placed in seclusion at 2:19pm and stayed in
seclusion until 4:30pm. The reason Youth A was placed in
seclusion was assault. Seclusion documentation for the 15-
minute checks did not describe the behavior of the youth during
those intervals but interviews with Staff 2 and Staff 5 verify the
youth was calm and did not display any emotional turbulence
while in the room. Staff 5 reported that when the supervisors did
come to check on Youth A, he was calm.
Youth A was placed into seclusion due to being assaulted by Staff
1. Initially, placing Youth A into the room while removing Staff 1
would help in maintaining safety. Once Staff 1 was removed from
the unit, there was no need for Youth A to be in seclusion.
Supervisor 2 reported in documentation that Youth A did not
appear to be emotionally under control, yet none of the staff
completing the checks verified this. Seclusion is not to be used for
fixed period of times and can only be used when youth is
engaging in behaviors that threaten the immediate harm of others.
Technical Assistance:
The youth observation sheet, concerning the 15-minute interval
logging should also acknowledge the behaviors the youth is
presenting if the youth will remain in the seclusion room.
The Administrative Review Form for Use of Seclusion Room does
not have an area to write out what behaviors the youth is
performing to remain in seclusion. In this particular case, Youth A
had a check box stating, “The youth does not appear to be under
6

emotional control.” This statement is vague. Another checkbox
states, “The youth states he us unwilling to cooperate with
program expectations.” This is not a reason outlined in the rules to
continue seclusion. Documentation appears to be outdated and
does not coincide with all seclusion procedures. The agency will
need to look at their processes, documentation and review to
ensure the proper procedures are practiced.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description
(1) The agency shall develop and implement written
procedures for health status screening, notifications,
debriefing, and reporting when a restraint including an
emergency restraint, or seclusion is used.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff placed Youth A into seclusion and did not follow procedures.
Investigation Youth A:
Youth A reported after the incident he was placed into his room for
seclusion until 4:30, after which he then saw the nurse.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the Unusual Incident Report dated 9/26/23. Youth A
was placed into seclusion after he was assaulted by Staff 1. The
reason was not documented on the form.
I reviewed the Medical Assessment dated 9/26/23. Youth was
seen at 4:30pm.
I requested seclusion documents on 10/30/23 and 11/4/23. No
documentation was provided.
I reviewed the current Use of Seclusion Room and Reintegration
Form Seclusion Policy. The current policy is not updated to reflect
Rule 400.4163.
Analysis The agency does not have written procedures, specifically
concerning the health status screening.
7

Technical Assistance: The agency will need to look at their
current policies and update them in accordance with Rule
400.4163 and Rule 400.4162. Both rules outline seclusion and
certain processes that must be implemented in the agency policy.
It is advised that the Final Rule Restraint and Seclusion to be
reviewed to ensure all the agency’s policies align with these rules
that became effective 5/24/2022.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health
Description service policies and procedures addressing all of the
following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and
behavioral health care.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation After youth was physically assaulted by Staff 1, youth was not
seen by medical staff immediately.
Investigation Interviews:
Nurse 1:
Nurse 1 reported that staff are to send a referral for youth to the
medical department for the medical staff to see youth. Nurse 1
reported that she did not have a referral for Youth A in their file.
Nurse 1 was shown the Medical Assessment and she reported
that she had not filled that particular one out.
Staff 5
Staff 5 reported after the incident she was instructed to keep
Youth A in his room. Staff 5 did not state who instructed her to
keep him in his room. Staff 5 reported she would check on him
and ask him if he was okay. Staff 5 reported she was concerned
about Youth A being hurt. Staff 5 reported she was trying to make
sure his head wasn’t hurt badly by monitoring him. Staff 5 reported
Youth A had scratches on his neck and his skin was red from
being “tossed” around. Staff 5 reported that “guards” came in later
and took him to the nurse.
I reviewed video of the incident.
Youth A was placed into his room at 2:19pm on 9/26/23.
8

Documents:
I reviewed the Health Services Policies and Procedures:
“When a youth…is in need of emergency medical care, the
Supervisor is to contact the Facility Nurse and Facility Physician
or Psychiatrist to arrange treatment at the appropriate medical
center.”
I reviewed the Unusual Incident Report Summary:
The incident was written on 9/26/23. The incident occurred at
2:17pm. It was noted as a “staff assault on resident.” The incident
report stated, “Staff 1 charged towards Youth A, throwing a punch
with his left hand…grabbed him by the shoulders and slammed
Youth A to the floor with his hands around his neck…”
I reviewed a Medical Assessment Note dated 9/26/23.
The medical assessment was noted Youth A was seen at 4:30.
“Youth reports throwing urine on staff. Staff then assaulted
resident by pushing him into the wall then slammed him onto the
floor punching him in the face numerous times then pulled up from
floor and choked until gasped for air.”
The medical assessment noted he had “mild bruising on nose,
scratches on neck, chest, shoulders and right hand, abrasions on
left wrist and swelling.” Staff were to monitor for 24 hours in case
of “neuro changes”. X-rays were ordered.
I reviewed the Radiology Report dated 9/27/23:
No evidence of acute fracture or dislocation in the wrist. No acute
cardiopulmonary process. No soft tissue abnormality or foreign
body (neck). No acute nasal bone fracture (nose).
Analysis Youth was physically assaulted by Staff 1 at 2:17pm and placed
into his room at 2:19pm. Youth A did not receive medical care for
over two hours, although he was punched, choked, and thrown by
Staff 1. A referral was not completed as Nurse 1 did not have one
in her system, but a medical assessment was completed at 4:30.
Conclusion Violation Established
9

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157 Behavior management
Section (2) At a minimum, the behavior management system shall
Description include all of the following:
(b) Positive intervention strategies to assist residents in
developing improved problem solving, self-management, and
social skills.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Agency was aware of youth being bullied but did not provide
interventions to staff to use to provide safety of all residents.
Investigation Staff 6:
Staff 6 reported that Youth B does bully other youth in the unit, but
he is not the only one. Staff 6 reported that Youth B takes other
people’s youth food, pushes them out of their chairs, etc. Staff 6
reported they (staff) monitor the unit on cameras, and they now
pass out of the food instead of youth passing to each other. Staff 6
reported those are the interventions in place at this time.
Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported that Youth A is easily influenced, and that other
youth can tell him what to do and he will do it. Staff 2 reported that
Youth A has spit on other staff and punched other staff because
other youth have physically threatened him if he didn’t do it.
Staff 2 reported that Youth A was being threatened by other
peers. Staff 2 reported that Youth A would give his snacks and his
food to Youth B, noting she has seen it. Staff 2 reported that she
has seen Youth A receive his snacks and tray of food and walk
over to Youth B and give him all his food. Staff 2 reported that she
has gone over and taken the food back and given it back to Youth
A. Staff 2 reported that the staff have discussed that Youth A is
being bullied but no one has told them what to do to problem solve
this. Staff 2 reported they have not been given any treatment
interventions to stop this behavior. Staff 2 reported she is unsure
how long the bullying has been going on. Staff 2 reported she did
see Staff 1 take Youth A for 1 on 1 time to remove Youth A from
possible bullying.
Staff 3:
Staff 3 reported he was not aware of any bullying occurring with
Youth A. Staff 3 reported there “is always something going on in
that unit.” Staff 3 reported about two weeks ago he heard about
the “contract” in one of his agency trainings. Staff 3 reported he
10

does not go to team meetings. Staff 3 reported there are only
meetings concerning policy changes.
Therapist 1:
Therapist 1 reported she was not aware that Youth A was being
bullied. Therapist 1 reported that she never had any therapy
sessions with Youth A concerning bullying. Therapist 1 reported
that she did a group meeting with all the youth to discuss bullying
because it was a “pod issue.” Therapist 1 reported no other details
as to why she knew this or what triggered her to complete a
session for bullying with the whole group other than it was a pod
issue. On 11/6/23, this consultant sent an email to Therapist 1
asking for clarification on whether she attended team meetings
with staff on Thursdays.
Therapist 1 reported via email on 11/6/23, “During the month of
August and September, team meetings did not take place on
Thursdays due to lack of treatment staff. Myself, Supervisor 2 and
some staff on the pod debrief usually in the control room.”
Youth A:
Youth A reported he threw urine on Staff 1 because Youth B
threatened to assault him if he did not do it. Youth A reported that
Youth B hit him about a month ago and since then threatens him
and takes his snacks and food. Youth A reported that Youth B will
take his meals in the dining hall and his 3:00pm snack. Youth A
reported that Youth B runs the unit. Youth A reported Supervisor 1
and Therapist 1 were aware he was being bullied by Youth B.
They were both aware he was giving away snacks and dinners to
Youth B. Youth A reported that Supervisor 1 would give him extra
snacks at night because he knew he was giving his away.
Youth C
Youth C reported that Youth B takes snacks, lunches, and dinners
from Youth A.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported he has seen Youth A give his food to Youth
B in the dining hall. Supervisor 1 reported he has taken the food
back from Youth B and has waited to give Youth A his food later at
night when he is in his room. Supervisor 1 reported that about
two-three months ago Youth A and Youth B were in a fight. After
this fight, Supervisor 2 found a paper “contract” in Youth B’s room
with Youth A’s name on it. The “contract” stated that Youth A
could join the “graveyard” gang if he would perform tasks for him
or do things to staff when he asked. The “contract” went on to say
11

that Youth A would give Youth B his snacks and food. The
contract was good for 30 days and that Youth B would assess if
he could be a part of this gang. Supervisor 2 reported there was a
contract for Youth D as well. Supervisor 1 reported that he and
Supervisor 2 gave this information to Therapist 1. Supervisor 1
reported that he did not do anything about it or tell anyone other
than Therapist 1. Supervisor 1 reported he could never catch
Youth B doing anything, so he never did anything. Supervisor 1
reported that Supervisor 2 is the manager for that unit and this
should have been discussed by Supervisor 2 in team meetings.
Administrator 1:
Administrator 1 reported she has not been given information about
a “graveyard” gang, and was not aware of the bullying until after
the incident in the unit.
Staff 3:
Staff 3 reported she was unaware of any bullying in the unit. Staff
3 reported they have never discussed bullying in team meetings.
Staff 3 reported she does not receive individual supervision with
her supervisor. Staff 3 reported she only receives new policy
changes in their Thursday team meetings.
Staff 4:
Staff 4 reported he was unaware of a gang being formed named
“graveyard” and did not receive interventions in team meeting
concerning bullying on the unit.
Staff 5:
Staff 5 reported she has been working at the facility for two
months and knew that Youth A was being bullied by Youth B. Staff
5 reported that Youth B was taking his food and “making him do
things” even prior to when she was hired. Staff 5 reported Youth A
would get his meal and then walk over to Youth B and give it to
him. Staff 5 reported she would sometimes go and get the meal
back from Youth B and give it to Youth A, but then Youth A would
just give it back to him. Staff 5 reported she was told “to not let
other youth bully other youth.” Staff 5 reported she was not given
interventions to use to stop the bullying just told not to let it
happen. Staff 5 reported Youth B would take Youth A’s snacks as
well. Staff 5 reported they have not discussed bullying in team
meetings until after this incident. Staff 5 reported she does not
know what “graveyard” is.
12

Documents Reviewed:
Therapist 1 was unable to provide documentation on her group
session discussing bullying on the pod.
I reviewed Team Meeting Agendas.
8/10/23: No discussion on bullying or interventions to use for
bullying. Individuals present: Supervisor 2, Therapist 1, Staff 7
8/17/23: Under what “challenges did staff confront” or “questions
to discuss’, “bullying” is in parenthesis. The implementation of the
treatment was to “separate the pod.” Individuals present:
Supervisor 2, Therapist 1, Staff 2, and Staff 7
8/24/23: Under “barriers/opportunities to implementation of
treatment”, residents that we felt were being targeted we moved
them over to the classroom which all staff were aware of.”
“Bullying” is noted under challenges or questions” of staff.
Individuals present: Supervisor 2, Therapist 1, and Staff 7
Under “Program Updates” three peers were mentioned as stating
they are aware of bullying or want to be moved because they are
being threatened by peers or peers are trying to take their food.
Youth C reported it was the older peers bullying the younger
peers.
9/7/23: Under “barriers/opportunities to implementation of
treatment”, residents that we felt were being targeted we moved
them over to the classroom which all staff were aware of.”
“Thinking about bringing them back into group.”
“Bullying” is noted under challenges or questions” of staff.
Individuals Present: Supervisor 2 and Therapist 1
9/14/23: “Residents are not getting moved anymore, we will
address any issues as a group and deal with those that are
causing issues.” Under barriers/opportunities, “separating the pod
because of behaviors and we felt that some resident might be
getting targeted but weren’t sure and so we moved them back to
the pod to get to the bottom of things residents won’t tell us who it
was.” Under “Program Updates” three peers were mentioned as
stating they are aware of bullying or want to be moved because
they are being threatened by peers or peers are trying to take their
food. Youth C reported it was the older peers bullying the younger
peers. Individuals Present: Supervisor 2, Therapist 1, and Staff 7
I reviewed the Unusual Incident Report noted by Supervisor 1
between Youth A and Youth B.
13

The date of the incident report is 7/13/23. “Youth B attacked Youth
A and began striking him several times by punching him in the
face, spitting on him while holding him on the floor.”
I reviewed Youth B’s court report dated 7/31/23.
“Youth B received multiple rule violations among them are assault
on peers, continued negative behaviors, and threatening/bullying.”
I reviewed the SJJS Behavior Management System,
Behavioral Intervention Techniques, Safe Physical
Intervention:
All SJJS staff members are responsible for using problem solving,
conflict resolution and verbal crisis intervention/prevention
techniques and the GA problem solving meetings to deescalate
non-assaultive consumer behaviors…Staff are toe be trained in
this system annually. The system is also to be reviewed annually
and staff and youth shall be provided opportunity to provide input
into the proper application of this process.
I reviewed the Discipline policy:
Misdemeanor Rule Violations are listed as: Gang activity,
continued negative behaviors, trading of any item threatening the
safety of others, intimidating, or bullying, encouraging
inappropriate behavior in others.
Staff will select one or two consequences to help youth:
• A loss of free time recreation privileges for 3 days
• A loss of merit store purchases for 3 days
• Assignment to thinking table for three days complete an
additional rational thinking reports
• Cleanup duties for 3 days
• Return to level one merit system privileges for 5 days.
• Restitution to the person wronged or restorative justice
project for the community (pod)
Analysis The agency did not provide positive intervention strategies to staff
to secure safety and provide individual treatment to youth outlined
in the Program Statement and Behavior Management and
Discipline Policy.
• Supervisor 1 reported he was aware of the bullying after
the incident between Youth A and Youth B on 7/13/23.
Supervisor 2 provided Supervisor 1 with a “contract” laying
out how to be in the “graveyard” gang from Youth B to
Youth A and Youth D.
14

• Supervisor 1 reported this contract was then given to
Therapist 1.
• Therapist 1 noted she was unaware of specific bullying in
the pod yet wrote about bullying in her court report for
Youth B dated 7/31/23. Team meeting agendas noted
Therapist 1 in the meetings and “bullying” discussed.
• Team meeting agendas were provided noting bullying was
an ongoing issue. Therapist 1 reported she did not attend
team meetings but met in the control room and debriefed
with Supervisor 2 and other staff.
• Supervisor 1, Staff 2, Staff 6, Supervisor 2, Therapist 1
where all aware bullying was occurring on the unit.
• Staff 3 and Staff 4 were unaware of the bullying going on in
the unit.
• Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 5, and Staff 6 all reported
there were no interventions discussed in team meetings
about how to handle bullying.
• Administrator 1 was unaware of the “graveyard” gang or
bullying in the unit.
Based on interviews and documents, there is a lack of
communication amongst the treatment team, supervisors and
administration and a lack of treatment planning. Team meetings
do not include intervention strategies or staff involvement. Team
meeting agendas are written with non-specific plans and appear to
not be formal meetings. There appears to be a lack of
accountability and cohesion. Supervisor 1 was aware of the
bullying in July 2023 and reported this to Therapist 1, who wrote
about it in a court report. Supervisor 2 was aware of the bullying
due to being in team meetings and documenting it. Staff working
on the unit are aware of bullying but not aware of interventions to
use. Staff all report they are not discussing bullying in team
meetings, yet from the team meeting agendas, there are few to no
staff in the meetings.
Consultation: Team meeting agendas do not have signatures or
clinical oversight to ensure treatment module is being followed.
Oversight is warranted due to lack of staff involvement and
programming/clinical interventions. It would benefit the units if the
team meeting agendas coincided with their therapeutic design,
outlining group interventions for stage of development as well as
individual interventions for individual growth. It would also benefit
the agency if staff were present in the team meetings.
Conclusion Violation Established
